vote.title: To authorize the Director of the Department of Development to enter into an agreement with M/I Homes of Central Ohio, for fulfillment of Northeast Pay as We Grow requirements for property located at 4570 Central College Road. ($0.00)
vote.description:
Explanation
 
Background: M/I Homes of Central Ohio, LLC (“Developer”) is the prospective owner of approximately 27.9± acres of property located at 4570 Central College Road (the “Subject Property”) in the northeast area of the Columbus Pay as We Grow (PAWG) program. The Developer has submitted a request to rezone the Subject Property from PUD-4, Planned United Development District to PUD-4, Planned Unit Development District (H-35), which will allow a total of up to 138 units on the Subject Property (Rezoning Application #Z25-023).
Pursuant to Ordinance No. 1349-2021, the Subject Property was included in the rezoning of ±58.3 acres of property annexed from Blendon Township to the City of Columbus as part of a Rezoning Application (#Z20-099) submitted by Treplus Communities (the “2021 Rezoning”). The 2021 Rezoning provided the property with a full access point to Central College Road, which was located within the limits of the City’s Northeast MOU - Central College Ulry Road Reconstruction project (the “CIP Project”). In lieu of constructing the property’s Central College Road access point, Treplus Communities made a contribution to the City, in the amount of $500,000, for costs associated with incorporating the construction of said access point into the CIP Project (the “Central College Contribution”).
 
This legislation authorizes the Director of the Department of Development to enter into a Pay as We Grow Agreement (“Agreement”) with the Developer for fulfillment of the following PAWG requirements:1) the Central College Contribution will be memorialized as the Developer’s fulfillment of the standard $2,300 per residential unit contribution for the northeast PAWG (the “Per Unit Contribution) and 2) the Developer will cooperate with the City to create a new tax increment financing (TIF) incentive district that includes the Subject Property.
 
Fiscal Impact: No funding is required for this legislation.
 
Title
 
To authorize the Director of the Department of Development to enter into an agreement with M/I Homes of Central Ohio, for fulfillment of Northeast Pay as We Grow requirements for property located at 4570 Central College Road. ($0.00)
 
Body
 
WHEREAS, M/I Homes of Central Ohio, LLC, an Ohio limited liability corporation (“Developer”), is the prospective owner of approximately 27.9± acres of property located at 4570 Central College Road (the “Subject Property”) in the northeast area of the Columbus Pay As We Grow (PAWG) program; and
 
WHEREAS, pursuant to Ordinance No. 1349-2021, the Subject Property was included in the rezoning of ±58.3 acres of property annexed from Blendon Township to the City of Columbus as part of a Rezoning Application (#Z20-099) submitted by Treplus Communities (the “2021 Rezoning”); and
 
WHEREAS, the 2021 Rezoning provided the property with a full access point to Central College Road, which was located within the limits of the City’s Northeast MOU - Central College Ulry Road Reconstruction project (the “CIP Project”); and
 
WHEREAS, in lieu of constructing the property’s Central College Road access point, Treplus Communities made a contribution to the City, in the amount of $500,000, for costs associated with incorporating the construction of said access point into the CIP Project (the “Central College Contribution”); and
 
WHEREAS, the City and the Developer desire to enter into a Pay As We Grow Agreement (the “Agreement”) for fulfillment of PAWG requirements; and
 
WHEREAS, the purpose of the Agreement is to align sufficient, satisfactory Public Improvements, and the financing thereof, with planned and balanced development in the Northeast Pay as We Grow Area; and
 
WHEREAS, the Agreement shall memorialize the Central College Contribution as fulfillment of the PAWG Per Unit Contribution requirement; and
 
WHEREAS, the City and Developer agree that the Developer’s participation in the Northeast Pay As We Grow program will assist and benefit the City in planning, designing, and constructing regionally beneficial improvements in the northeast quadrant of Franklin County; NOW, THEREFORE,
 
BE IT ORDAINED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE CITY OF COLUMBUS:
 
SECTION 1. That the Director of the Department of Development (the “Director”), or his or her designee, on behalf of the City, is authorized to enter into the Pay As We Grow Agreement with M/I Homes of Central Ohio, LLC or subsequent owner(s) presently on file with the Department of Development (the “Agreement”), along with any changes or amendments thereto not inconsistent with this Ordinance and not substantially adverse to the City and which shall be approved by the Director and the City Attorney; provided that the approval of such changes and amendments are not substantially adverse to the City, which shall be evidenced conclusively by the execution of the Agreement that it outlines the plans and certain commitments of the City and the Developer relating to the Pay As We Grow Program for the proposed development on the Subject Property.
 
SECTION 2. This ordinance shall take effect and be in force from and after the earliest date permitted by law.
